intro: Mariscus firmipes, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to saline and arid environments. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is known for its aromatic properties. Mariscus firmipes thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing along rocky shores and dunes. Its unique morphology makes it a notable species in coastal botany and horticulture.
